text: President Ronald Reagan and speechwriter Peggy Noonan in the Oval Office, 1988. A Gainsborough chair (also known as a Martha Washington chair in the United States) is a type of armchair made in England in the eighteenth century. The chair was wide, with a high back, open sides and short arms, and was normally upholstered in leather. Contemporaries referred to it as a 'French chair', as the most elaborate styles were based on French Rococo chairs from the Louis XV period. ==References== * Category:Chairs
title: Gainsborough chair
